snippet: Ten new playing fields at Van Cortlandt Park make up the largest cricket site in the United States, city officials say, and reflect the growing diversity of New Yorkers and their pastimes.
abstract: Cricket complex in Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx, part of $13 million renovation and largest site for sport in the United States, reflects growing diversity of New Yorkers and their pastimes; cricket, which originated in Great Britain, is favored by many of New York City's West Indian and South Asian immigrants.
lead_paragraph: Ten new playing fields at Van Cortlandt Park make up the largest cricket site in the United States, city officials say, and reflect the growing diversity of New Yorkers and their pastimes.

headline.seo: Cricket Finds a Home in the Bronx
headline.main: Sport of Many Nations Finds a Home in the Bronx
headline.print_headline: Sport of Many Nations Finds a Home in the Bronx
